sec.p: A respect for the stakeholders and communities, the clarification of data collection objectives, the interactive approach and the recognition of information limitations were used as a basis for analysing the data acquired [ 30]. All the information provided through the surveys was analysed following the union model of the different individual competences [ 31]. The LEK about sardine was analysed through an emic-etic approach [ 32], and the data generated by the community were compared with the scientific literature [ 16]. The wealth of information and depth of perceptions in the data collected were analysed through careful coding and cross-checking to ensure the objectivity of the study [ 27]. Species nomenclature data were analysed following the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) [ 33], the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) [ 34], and Fish Base [ 35]. The data obtained in the interviews were stored and standardized in EXCEL and analysed (descriptive statistics) in the R Project for Statistical Computing version 3.3.2 [ 36].
